scope

Class IntegerScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • scope.IntegerScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scope<java.lang.Integer>

    public class IntegerScope
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scope<java.lang.Integer>
    Implements a scope of integers. The scope is limited by a minimum and maximum value (both included within the scope).
    Version:
    October 2019
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int maximum 
      private int minimum 
      private java.util.Random random 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntegerScope()
      No limits are given.
      IntegerScope(int value)
      Only one value is given.
      IntegerScope(int minimum, int maximum)
      The most specific constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.lang.Integer value)
      Check whether a value is within the scope.
      java.lang.Integer getValue()
      Get a value within the scope of this Scope.
      int size()
      How many values are there within this scope? Since the scope is inclusive of the maximum and minimum, the number of values in the scope is one more than the difference between the maximum and minimum.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • minimum

        private int minimum

      • maximum

        private int maximum

      • random

        private java.util.Random random

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntegerScope

        public IntegerScope(int minimum,
                    int maximum)
        The most specific constructor. Minimum and maximum are given explicitly.
        Parameters:
        minimum - the smallest value in this scope.
        maximum - the largest value in this scope.

      • IntegerScope

        public IntegerScope(int value)
        Only one value is given. If this is less than zero, then it is the minimum value in this scope (with zero as the maximum). Otherwise, zero is the minimum, and the value provided is the maximum.
        Parameters:
        value - the minimum or maximum value in this scope.

      • IntegerScope

        public IntegerScope()
        No limits are given.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Integer getValue()
        Get a value within the scope of this Scope.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Scope<java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        a random element within this scope.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Integer value)
        Check whether a value is within the scope.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Scope<java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is between the minimum and the maximum (inclusive).

      • size

        public int size()
        How many values are there within this scope? Since the scope is inclusive of the maximum and minimum, the number of values in the scope is one more than the difference between the maximum and minimum.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Scope<java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        the number of values in this scope.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
